posts.post_content: Looking for a strong, well-centered 5/60, would consider an extremely strong 4.  Thanks for reading.

Not to derail your BST post about this Peter, but isn't it sort of interesting how difficult it is to find some relatively common cards in really nice condition? There are a ton of these cards that get sold and almost none that look great. (forget technical grade). I bet if I showed you a strong looking Young with near 50/50 centering, sharper corners, but a touch of paper loss on a blank area on the back, you would consider it...even if in a 2 holder?  Good luck in the quest. I won't heckle you again (yet) :).
Yeah i have certainly had that experience with Goudey Ruths for example.
There is a beauty in Goodwin's current auction. Not mine.
Thanks saw it. It will go for a world record price no doubt.

just got off the phone with rea earlier. going to be one in there. there are also a couple on ebay right now i think.

kevin
